intro: Pollinia articulata var. pedicellata, commonly known as the pedicellate pollinia, is a variant of the pollinia plant characterized by its unique floral structure. It is a flowering plant belonging to the family Orchidaceae, known for its specialized reproductive system. The plant features elongated, club-shaped pollinia that are attached to a pedicellate structure, facilitating efficient pollination. Its flowers are typically small and clustered, with vibrant colors to attract pollinators. This variant is often found in tropical and subtropical regions where it thrives in humid, shaded environments.
